reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: A Path to the Phased Elimination of Malaria from Bangladesh

description.narrative: Bangladesh - Malaria - Economic Relations Division, Ministry of Finance of the People's Republic of Bangladesh - MOF Bangladesh. This program has the following goals: By 2025, reduce malaria annual parasite incidence (API) to less than 1 per 1,000 population at risk in CHT districts, interrupt local transmission and eliminate indigenous malaria in phased manner in 10 other endemic districts, determine malaria-free status of remaining 51 districts.. The objectives of this program are: To achieve and sustain universal coverage by case detection and prompt and complete treatment of all confirmed cases through 2025.. To achieve and sustain universal coverage of population at risk with appropriate preventive interventions through 2025.. To strengthen context-specific surveillance in all malaria settings and outbreak preparedness and response through 2025.. To strengthen program management, monitoring & evaluation, partnership and coordination through 2025.. To strengthen and expand research through 2025.

Impact indicator for BGD-M-NMCP
Annual parasite incidence: Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year (Elimination settings)
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Malaria I-other 1: Malaria deaths per 100,000 population
Coverage / Output indicator for BGD-M-NMCP
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of confirmed cases fully investigated and classified
CM -Other 1: Number of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test (disaggregated by age <5 and 5+, sex and type of testing -microscopy or RDTs)
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period
Outcome indicator for BGD-M-NMCP
Annual blood examination rate: per 100 population per year (Elimination settings)
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
